metadata.Description: Foundational energy infrastructure refers to the essential physical structures and systems that support the production, distribution, and consumption of energy.

level 1.Description: Foundational energy infrastructure implements energy efficiency policies that promote the use of energy-saving technologies and practices.
Foundational energy infrastructure funds renewable energy projects to support the transition to clean and sustainable energy sources.
Foundational energy infrastructure focuses on grid modernization to improve the efficiency and reliability of energy distribution.
Foundational energy infrastructure is involved in the Energy Access Initiative to provide reliable and affordable energy to underserved communities.
Foundational energy infrastructure partners with private sector companies to leverage their expertise and resources in sustainable energy projects.
Foundational energy infrastructure contributes to climate change mitigation efforts by promoting the use of clean and renewable energy sources.
Foundational energy infrastructure monitors energy consumption patterns to identify areas for improvement and optimize energy usage.
Foundational energy infrastructure sets targets for energy efficiency to drive the adoption of energy-saving technologies and practices.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency employs energy audits to identify energy-saving opportunities and optimize energy use.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies collaborate with research institutions to advance scientific knowledge and develop new technologies for renewable energy generation.

level 2.Subject: energy and modernization
level 2.Description: Energy and modernization implements rigorous building standards that promote the use of energy-saving designs and materials.

level 2.Subject: energy and modernization
level 2.Description: Energy and modernization funds renewable energy projects to support the transition to clean and sustainable energy sources.

level 3.Subject: energy storage
level 3.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

level 3.Subject: energy markets
level 3.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

level 3.Subject: renewable energy certificates
level 3.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.

level 3.Subject: energy efficiency
level 3.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.
